titleStmt.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to James G. Blaine, January 20, 1892

bibl.title: Despatch from William D. McCoy to James G. Blaine
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Honorable James G. Blaine,
Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
In response to yours of the 18th, instant I will say that I have the honor of accepting the position of Minister-Resident and Consul-General to Liberia.
Enclosed please find Oath and Bond as required.

In compliance with your letter, I shall await further instructions before leaving here, but hope to be able to leave on Saturday, January 30th., which will allow one to report to you in person on the following Monday morning.
In further response to your letter I will say:-

1. I was born in Cambridge City, Indiana, November 17th., 1853
2. I am appointed from Indiana
3. I have never resided in Liberia

Very respectfully,
Your obedient servant,
William D. McCoy
